ผู้สร้าง Cardano เรียกร้องให้ชุมชน ADA รวมตัวกันในระหว่าง Crypto Bloodbath มูลค่า 1.05 พันล้านดอลลาร์

Cardano Creator Calls on ADA Community Amid $1.05 Billion Crypto Bloodbath

1d ago//Gamza Khanzadaev
nftaltcoins
AI

Summary

TH

แม้ว่าตลาดคริปโตจะกำลังประสบกับการขายทิ้งครั้งใหญ่กว่า 1.05 พันล้านดอลลาร์ แต่ Charles Hoskinson ผู้ก่อตั้ง Cardano ก็ได้เปิดตัว "Logan the Exit Liquidity Lobster" ซึ่งเป็น AI agent ที่ออกแบบมาเพื่อลงทุนในระบบนิเวศอย่างแข็งขัน โดย Logan ไม่ใช่เพียงตัวรวบรวมข้อมูล แต่ใช้ฟังก์ชันของ Lace wallet เพื่อเข้าไปถือตำแหน่งใน meme coins, NFTs และ culture-driven dApps บน Cardano ผสมผสานการเดาสถานการณ์ตลาดเข้ากับความตระหนักรู้เกี่ยวกับโปรโตคอลผ่าน API hooks และ analytics นักพัฒนาในชุมชน Cardano ตอบรับอย่างอุ่นอกอุ่นใจ โดยผู้ก่อตั้งโปรเจกต์ต่างๆ กำลังส่งแบบฟอร์มเพื่อขอร่วมงานกับ AI ตัวนี้ Hoskinson มีเป้าหมายที่จะยกระดับความสามารถของ Logan ให้กลายเป็น Cardano-native oracle ในอนาคต พร้อมกับอัปเดตความปลอดภัยเพื่อรับมือกับภัยคุกคามจากเทคโนโลยีควอนตัมที่มีต่อสินทรัพย์ดิจิทัล

EN

Amid a significant $1.05 billion market downturn, Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson has introduced "Logan the Exit Liquidity Lobster," an AI-powered agent designed to actively invest in the ecosystem. Unlike a passive aggregator, Logan utilizes integrated Lace wallet functionality to take positions in Cardano-based meme coins, NFTs, and culture-driven dApps, blending market speculation with protocol awareness through API hooks and analytics. Developers within the Cardano community have responded enthusiastically, with founders of various projects submitting integration forms to work with the AI. Hoskinson aims to enhance Logan's capabilities to potentially create a Cardano-native oracle, while simultaneously implementing security updates to address concerns regarding quantum threats targeting digital assets.

Key Points

  • Cardano founder Charles Hoskinson launches "Logan," an AI agent to actively invest in ecosystem tokens.
  • Logan uses Lace wallet to take positions in Cardano-based meme coins, NFTs, and dApps.
  • The AI aims to function as a Cardano-native oracle with security updates against quantum threats.
  • Developers are eager to integrate, submitting forms to collaborate with the new AI agent.

Article

Cardano Founder Charles Hoskinson remains a relentless crypto developer first, despite crypto itself getting destroyed in an epic $1.05 billion bloodbath on the derivatives market. Thus, his latest public call brought something intriguing to the space, and this time it is not about hard forks or workshopping it at some exotic point on the globe. Instead, Hoskinson is dispatching "Logan the Exit Liquidity Lobster" which, if you missed the narrative, is an AI-powered Moltbook personality. For what? To evaluate and potentially invest in Cardano-based meme coins, NFTs and culture-driven dApps. HOT Stories What is Logan, and how can it help Cardano? Logan is not just a passive aggregator, as was figured out previously. Thanks to newly integrated Lace wallet functionality, the AI agent will now actively choose which projects to "take a position in" — a move that injects a speculative edge into what was initially a content bot, but for ADA ecosystem tokens exclusively. If the name did not give it away, Logan is part mascot, part market participant, and possibly Cardano’s weirdest form of on-chain exposure yet. Source: Charles Hoskinson Hoskinson’s effort to embed Logan with deeper protocol awareness — via API hooks, token tracking and analytics functionality — signals a pivot toward automation and ecosystem indexing. If successful, Logan could become a real-time Cardano-native oracle, combining market instincts with developer integration data. Cardano and AI Developers are responding. NFT project founders, meme coin creators and Cardano infrastructure devs are piling into Hoskinson’s replies, some already submitting integration forms. Patrick Tobler, founder of NFT platform NMKR, claims he has already sent in an email, eager to have Logan onboard. You Might Also Like As covered in Hoskinson’s recent AllInCrypto appearance, Cardano (ADA) is racing to reconcile its research-first design ethos with real-world utility, including major security updates for Logan. These updates aim to harden the AI’s attack surface and, first of all, this is being done because of growing fears of quantum threats targeting digital assets. Whether Logan becomes the ecosystem’s first meme-VC or just a glorified bot remains to be seen — but Hoskinson's method of assembling its builders is anything but boring.
